metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8709 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
** DISPUTED ** kernel/ptrace.c in the Linux kernel through 4.4.1 mishandlesuid and gid mappings, which allows local users to gain privileges byestablishing a user namespace, waiting for a root process to enter thatnamespace with an unsafe uid or gid, and then using the ptrace system call. NOTE: the vendor states "there is no kernel bug here."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8709` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-51-generic - 4.4.0-51.72
linux-image-4.4.0-51-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-51.72
linux-image-4.4.0-51-lowlatency - 4.4.0-51.72
linux-image-4.4.0-51-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-51.72
linux-image-4.4.0-51-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-51.72
linux-image-4.4.0-51-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-51.72
linux-image-4.4.0-51-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-51.72
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-51-generic - 4.4.0-51.72
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1038-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1038.45
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1042-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1042.46
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
No subscription required

linux-image-4.8.0-36-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-36-generic-lpae - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-36-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.8.0-36-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-51.72').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1038.45').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1042.46').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-gke package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
